title: Authors and Citation
text: Nicholas Nasser. Author, maintainer.

title: Authors and Citation
text: Nasser N (2025). sparseVector: Efficient Sparse Numeric Vector Implementation. R package version 0.1.0, https://github.com/sous20/sparseVector.
code: @Manual{,   title = {sparseVector: Efficient Sparse Numeric Vector Implementation},   author = {Nicholas Nasser},   year = {2025},   note = {R package version 0.1.0},   url = {https://github.com/sous20/sparseVector}, }

title: Efficient Sparse Numeric Vector Implementation
text: Efficient sparse numeric vector implementation R.

title: Efficient Sparse Numeric Vector Implementation
text: can install development version GitHub:
code: # install.packages("devtools") devtools::install_github("sous20/sparseVector")

title: Efficient Sparse Numeric Vector Implementation
text: basic example shows solve common problem:
code: library(sparseVector) #>  #> Attaching package: 'sparseVector' #> The following object is masked from 'package:base': #>  #>     norm  # Create a sparse vector x <- as(c(1, 0, 0, 4, 0), "sparse_numeric") y <- as(c(0, 2, 0, 1, 0), "sparse_numeric")  # Perform operations sparse_add(x, y) #> Sparse numeric vector of length 5  #> Non-zero values: #>   [1] = 1 #>   [2] = 2 #>   [4] = 5 mean(x) #> [1] 1 norm(x) #> [1] 4.123106

what: Coerce Numeric Vector to Sparse Numeric — coerce-numeric-sparse_numeric
title: Coerce Numeric Vector to Sparse Numeric — coerce-numeric-sparse_numeric
text: Converts regular numeric vector sparse_numeric object extracting non-zero values positions.

title: Coerce Numeric Vector to Sparse Numeric — coerce-numeric-sparse_numeric
text: numeric vector

title: Coerce Numeric Vector to Sparse Numeric — coerce-numeric-sparse_numeric
text: sparse_numeric object

title: Coerce Numeric Vector to Sparse Numeric — coerce-numeric-sparse_numeric
code: x <- as(c(1, 0, 0, 4, 0, 2), "sparse_numeric")

what: Coerce Sparse Numeric to Numeric Vector — coerce-sparse_numeric-numeric
title: Coerce Sparse Numeric to Numeric Vector — coerce-sparse_numeric-numeric
text: Converts sparse_numeric object regular numeric vector filling zeros appropriate positions.

title: Coerce Sparse Numeric to Numeric Vector — coerce-sparse_numeric-numeric
text: sparse_numeric object

title: Coerce Sparse Numeric to Numeric Vector — coerce-sparse_numeric-numeric
text: numeric vector

title: Coerce Sparse Numeric to Numeric Vector — coerce-sparse_numeric-numeric
code: x <- as(c(1, 0, 0, 4), "sparse_numeric") y <- as(x, "numeric")

what: Get Length of Sparse Numeric Vector — length,sparse_numeric-method
title: Get Length of Sparse Numeric Vector — length,sparse_numeric-method
text: Returns total length sparse numeric vector (including zero elements).

title: Get Length of Sparse Numeric Vector — length,sparse_numeric-method
code: # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric' length(x)

title: Get Length of Sparse Numeric Vector — length,sparse_numeric-method
text: x sparse_numeric object

title: Get Length of Sparse Numeric Vector — length,sparse_numeric-method
text: integer representing total length

title: Get Length of Sparse Numeric Vector — length,sparse_numeric-method
code: x <- as(c(1, 0, 0, 4, 0), "sparse_numeric") length(x)  # Returns 5 #> [1] 5

what: Calculate Mean of Sparse Numeric Vector — mean,sparse_numeric-method
title: Calculate Mean of Sparse Numeric Vector — mean,sparse_numeric-method
text: Computes mean sparse numeric vector, including zero elements calculation. operation performed efficiently without converting dense format.

title: Calculate Mean of Sparse Numeric Vector — mean,sparse_numeric-method
code: # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric' mean(x, ...)

title: Calculate Mean of Sparse Numeric Vector — mean,sparse_numeric-method
text: x sparse_numeric object ... Additional arguments (currently unused)

title: Calculate Mean of Sparse Numeric Vector — mean,sparse_numeric-method
text: numeric value representing mean

title: Calculate Mean of Sparse Numeric Vector — mean,sparse_numeric-method
code: x <- as(c(1, 0, 0, 4, 0), "sparse_numeric") mean(x)  # Returns 1 #> [1] 1

what: Compute the Norm of a Sparse Numeric Vector — norm
title: Compute the Norm of a Sparse Numeric Vector — norm
text: Calculates L2 (Euclidean) norm sparse numeric vector, square root sum squared elements. operation performed efficiently using non-zero values.

title: Compute the Norm of a Sparse Numeric Vector — norm
code: norm(x, ...)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric' norm(x, ...)

title: Compute the Norm of a Sparse Numeric Vector — norm
text: x sparse_numeric object ... Additional arguments (currently unused)

title: Compute the Norm of a Sparse Numeric Vector — norm
text: numeric value representing L2 norm

title: Compute the Norm of a Sparse Numeric Vector — norm
code: x <- as(c(3, 0, 4), "sparse_numeric") norm(x)  # Returns 5 #> [1] 5

what: Plot Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — plot,sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric-method
title: Plot Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — plot,sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric-method
text: Creates scatter plot showing overlapping non-zero elements two sparse numeric vectors.

title: Plot Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — plot,sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric-method
code: # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' plot(x, y, ...)

title: Plot Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — plot,sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric-method
text: x sparse_numeric object y sparse_numeric object ... Additional arguments passed plot()

title: Plot Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — plot,sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric-method
text: Invisible NULL (creates plot)

title: Plot Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — plot,sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric-method
code: x <- as(c(1, 0, 3, 0, 5), "sparse_numeric") y <- as(c(0, 2, 2, 0, 4), "sparse_numeric") plot(x, y)

what: Show Method for Sparse Numeric Vectors — show,sparse_numeric-method
title: Show Method for Sparse Numeric Vectors — show,sparse_numeric-method
text: Displays sparse_numeric object showing length non-zero values.

title: Show Method for Sparse Numeric Vectors — show,sparse_numeric-method
code: # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric' show(object)

title: Show Method for Sparse Numeric Vectors — show,sparse_numeric-method
text: object sparse_numeric object

title: Show Method for Sparse Numeric Vectors — show,sparse_numeric-method
text: Invisible NULL (prints console)

what: Add Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_add
title: Add Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_add
text: Performs element-wise addition two sparse numeric vectors returns sparse numeric vector.

title: Add Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_add
code: sparse_add(x, y, ...)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' sparse_add(x, y, ...)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' e1 + e2

title: Add Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_add
text: x sparse_numeric object y sparse_numeric object ... Additional arguments (currently unused) e1 sparse_numeric object (left operand) e2 sparse_numeric object (right operand)

title: Add Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_add
text: sparse_numeric object representing element-wise sum

title: Add Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_add
code: x <- as(c(1, 0, 3, 0), "sparse_numeric") y <- as(c(0, 2, 1, 0), "sparse_numeric") result <- sparse_add(x, y) # Returns sparse vector: [1, 2, 4, 0]

what: Compute Cross Product of Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_crossprod
title: Compute Cross Product of Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_crossprod
text: Calculates cross product (dot product) two sparse numeric vectors, returning single numeric value equal sum element-wise products.

title: Compute Cross Product of Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_crossprod
code: sparse_crossprod(x, y, ...)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' sparse_crossprod(x, y, ...)

title: Compute Cross Product of Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_crossprod
text: x sparse_numeric object y sparse_numeric object ... Additional arguments (currently unused)

title: Compute Cross Product of Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_crossprod
text: numeric value representing cross product

title: Compute Cross Product of Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_crossprod
code: x <- as(c(1, 0, 3, 0), "sparse_numeric") y <- as(c(0, 2, 2, 0), "sparse_numeric") result <- sparse_crossprod(x, y) # Returns 6 (= 1*0 + 0*2 + 3*2 + 0*0)

what: Multiply Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_mult
title: Multiply Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_mult
text: Performs element-wise multiplication two sparse numeric vectors returns sparse numeric vector.

title: Multiply Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_mult
code: sparse_mult(x, y, ...)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' sparse_mult(x, y, ...)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' e1 * e2

title: Multiply Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_mult
text: x sparse_numeric object y sparse_numeric object ... Additional arguments (currently unused) e1 sparse_numeric object (left operand) e2 sparse_numeric object (right operand)

title: Multiply Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_mult
text: sparse_numeric object representing element-wise product

title: Multiply Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_mult
code: x <- as(c(2, 0, 3, 0), "sparse_numeric") y <- as(c(0, 2, 1, 0), "sparse_numeric") result <- sparse_mult(x, y) # Returns sparse vector: [0, 0, 3, 0]

title: Sparse Numeric Vector Class — sparse_numeric-class
text: S4 class represent sparse numeric vectors efficiently storing non-zero values positions. useful vectors many zero elements, saving memory computation time.

title: Sparse Numeric Vector Class — sparse_numeric-class
text: value numeric vector containing non-zero values pos integer vector containing positions (indices) non-zero values length integer specifying total length vector (including zeros)

what: Subtract Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_sub
title: Subtract Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_sub
text: Performs element-wise subtraction two sparse numeric vectors returns sparse numeric vector.

title: Subtract Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_sub
code: sparse_sub(x, y, ...)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' sparse_sub(x, y, ...)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric,sparse_numeric' e1 - e2

title: Subtract Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_sub
text: x sparse_numeric object y sparse_numeric object ... Additional arguments (currently unused) e1 sparse_numeric object (left operand) e2 sparse_numeric object (right operand)

title: Subtract Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_sub
text: sparse_numeric object representing element-wise difference (x - y)

title: Subtract Two Sparse Numeric Vectors — sparse_sub
code: x <- as(c(5, 0, 3, 0), "sparse_numeric") y <- as(c(0, 2, 1, 0), "sparse_numeric") result <- sparse_sub(x, y) # Returns sparse vector: [5, -2, 2, 0]

what: Standardize a Sparse Numeric Vector — standardize
title: Standardize a Sparse Numeric Vector — standardize
text: Standardizes sparse numeric vector subtracting mean dividing standard deviation. result new sparse_numeric vector mean 0 standard deviation 1. operation performed efficiently without converting dense format.

title: Standardize a Sparse Numeric Vector — standardize
code: standardize(x, ...)  # S4 method for class 'sparse_numeric' standardize(x, ...)

title: Standardize a Sparse Numeric Vector — standardize
text: x sparse_numeric object ... Additional arguments (currently unused)

title: Standardize a Sparse Numeric Vector — standardize
text: standardized sparse_numeric object

title: Standardize a Sparse Numeric Vector — standardize
code: x <- as(c(1, 2, 3, 4, 5), "sparse_numeric") x_std <- standardize(x) mean(x_std)  # Approximately 0 #> [1] 0
